Sure, here's a revised curriculum that can be completed in 12 weeks, dedicating 10 hours per week:

Module 1: Introduction to Digital Product Design (10 hours)

* Overview of digital product design
* Principles of design thinking
* Understanding user-centered design
* Practical exercises to apply design thinking and user-centered design

Module 2: User Experience Design (UX) (10 hours)

* Understanding the user experience (UX) design process
* Developing user personas
* Creating user journey maps
* Wireframing and prototyping
* Practical exercises to apply UX design principles

Module 3: User Research (10 hours)

* Understanding user research methods and techniques
* Conducting user interviews
* Creating surveys and questionnaires
* Analyzing user data and feedback
* Practical exercises to apply user research methods

Module 4: User Interface Design (UI) (10 hours)

* Understanding user interface (UI) design principles
* Designing interfaces for mobile and web applications
* Using typography, color, and imagery in UI design
* Prototyping and testing UI designs
* Practical exercises to apply UI design principles

Module 5: Design Tools and Techniques (10 hours)

* Introduction to design software and tools
* Using graphic design tools for digital product design
* Creating design assets for digital products
* Design handoff and collaboration
* Practical exercises to use design software and tools

Module 6: Putting it All Together (10 hours)

* Applying all the principles and techniques learned throughout the curriculum
* Final project to create a digital product from start to finish
* Presenting and receiving feedback on the final project
* Practical exercises to refine the final project

This revised curriculum provides a comprehensive overview of digital product design and allows the learner to gain hands-on experience with each stage of the design process. The practical exercises throughout each module provide opportunities for the learner to apply the skills and techniques learned in each module. The final project in Module 6 allows the learner to apply all the skills and knowledge gained throughout the curriculum and showcase their ability to create a digital product from start to finish.
